alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Harnett; Hoke; Moore (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:24PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A slow moving storm producing heavy rain will impact portions of east central Moore, southwestern Harnett, northwestern Cumberland and northeastern Hoke Counties through 315 PM EDT... At 222 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong storm 8 miles east of Southern Pines, moving northwest at 10 mph. This storm has already produced around 1 inch of rainfall. HAZARD...Heavy rain may lead to localized flooding in poor drainage locations. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Bragg, Pope AFB, Spring Lake, Vass, Olivia, Anderson Creek and Timberlake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
